segment.source: Deploying an Inventory-Collector Package (Windows 10)
segment.target: Deploying an Inventory-Collector Package (Windows 10)

segment.source: Deploying an Inventory-Collector Package
segment.target: Deploying an Inventory-Collector Package

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: You can use the following methods to deploy an inventory-collector package to the destination computers:
segment.target: You can use the following methods to deploy an inventory-collector package to the destination computers:

segment.source: Group Policy Software Installation.
segment.target: Group Policy Software Installation.

segment.source: This is a feature of Active Directory Domain Services in Windows Server.
segment.target: This is a feature of Active Directory Domain Services in Windows Server.

segment.source: All computers to which you deploy the package must be part of the Active Directory forest.
segment.target: All computers to which you deploy the package must be part of the Active Directory forest.

segment.source: Logon script.
segment.target: Logon script.

segment.source: You can use Windows Script Host to create a logon script.
segment.target: You can use Windows Script Host to create a logon script.

segment.source: Installing by using a logon script requires administrator credentials on the local computer.
segment.target: Installing by using a logon script requires administrator credentials on the local computer.

segment.source: Microsoft® System Center Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Microsoft® System Center Configuration Manager.

segment.source: For information about how to use System Center Configuration Manager, see the product documentation.
segment.target: For information about how to use System Center Configuration Manager, see the product documentation.

segment.source: Manual distribution.
segment.target: Manual distribution.

segment.source: You can use a file server on the network as a software distribution point, or you can distribute removable media.
segment.target: You can use a file server on the network as a software distribution point, or you can distribute removable media.

segment.source: User installation of an inventory-collector package requires administrator credentials on the local computer.
segment.target: User installation of an inventory-collector package requires administrator credentials on the local computer.

segment.source: To deploy an inventory-collector package by using Group Policy Software Installation
segment.target: To deploy an inventory-collector package by using Group Policy Software Installation

segment.source: Ensure that the computers to which you want to deploy the inventory-collector package are members of the Active Directory forest.
segment.target: Ensure that the computers to which you want to deploy the inventory-collector package are members of the Active Directory forest.

segment.source: Create a Group Policy Object (GPO) for publishing the inventory-collector package.
segment.target: Create a Group Policy Object (GPO) for publishing the inventory-collector package.

segment.source: Assign the GPO to the organizational units (OUs) that contain the set of computers.
segment.target: Assign the GPO to the organizational units (OUs) that contain the set of computers.

segment.source: Create and publish a new software installation package by using Group Policy Software Installation.
segment.target: Create and publish a new software installation package by using Group Policy Software Installation.

segment.source: For information about the Group Policy Software Installation process, see Best practices for Group Policy Software Installation.
segment.target: For information about the Group Policy Software Installation process, see Best practices for Group Policy Software Installation.

segment.source: To assign a logon script for installing an inventory-collector package to an organizational unit
segment.target: To assign a logon script for installing an inventory-collector package to an organizational unit

segment.source: Create the logon script.
segment.target: Create the logon script.

segment.source: The following script is an example.
segment.target: The following script is an example.

segment.source: To keep the installation from running repeatedly, your script must create a marker.
segment.target: To keep the installation from running repeatedly, your script must create a marker.

segment.source: For more information about logon scripts, see Assign a Logon Script to a User in the Active Directory.
segment.target: For more information about logon scripts, see Assign a Logon Script to a User in the Active Directory.

segment.source: Save your script in the SYSVOLScripts folder.
segment.target: Save your script in the SYSVOLScripts folder.

segment.source: Open the Active Directory Users and Computers console by clicking Start, clicking All Programs, clicking Administrative Tools, and then clicking Active Directory Users and Computers.
segment.target: Open the Active Directory Users and Computers console by clicking Start, clicking All Programs, clicking Administrative Tools, and then clicking Active Directory Users and Computers.

segment.source: Right-click the OU to which you intend to assign the logon script, click Properties, and then click the Group Policy tab.
segment.target: Right-click the OU to which you intend to assign the logon script, click Properties, and then click the Group Policy tab.

segment.source: Click New to add a new GPO, or select an existing GPO and then click Edit.
segment.target: Click New to add a new GPO, or select an existing GPO and then click Edit.

segment.source: In the left pane, expand the User Configuration object, expand the Windows Setting object, and then click Scripts (Logon/Logoff).
segment.target: In the left pane, expand the User Configuration object, expand the Windows Setting object, and then click Scripts (Logon/Logoff).

segment.source: In the right pane, double-click the Logon script.
segment.target: In the right pane, double-click the Logon script.

segment.source: Click Add.
segment.target: Click Add.

segment.source: Click Browse, browse to the domainSysvolScripts folder, select your script, and then click Open.
segment.target: Click Browse, browse to the domainSysvolScripts folder, select your script, and then click Open.

segment.source: Click OK to close the Logon Properties dialog box.
segment.target: Click OK to close the Logon Properties dialog box.

segment.source: Close the Group Policy Management console and the Active Directory Users and Computers console.
segment.target: Close the Group Policy Management console and the Active Directory Users and Computers console.

segment.source: On a computer that is a member of the domain and a part of the OU, log on as an OU user.
segment.target: On a computer that is a member of the domain and a part of the OU, log on as an OU user.

segment.source: Open a Command Prompt window, and then type to force the update of the Group Policy setting.
segment.target: Open a Command Prompt window, and then type to force the update of the Group Policy setting.

segment.source: At the command prompt, type to verify your Group Policy assignment.
segment.target: At the command prompt, type to verify your Group Policy assignment.

segment.source: In the left pane, expand the Computer Configuration object, expand the Windows Setting object, and then click Security Settings.
segment.target: In the left pane, expand the Computer Configuration object, expand the Windows Setting object, and then click Security Settings.

segment.source: Expand Account Policies, click Password Policy, and verify the assigned Group Policy setting.
segment.target: Expand Account Policies, click Password Policy, and verify the assigned Group Policy setting.

segment.source: Close the Resultant Set of Policy console and the Command Prompt window.
segment.target: Close the Resultant Set of Policy console and the Command Prompt window.

segment.source: To deploy an inventory-collector package by using System Center Configuration Manager
segment.target: To deploy an inventory-collector package by using System Center Configuration Manager

segment.source: Verify that the computers to which you want to deploy the package are included in your Configuration Manager inventory.
segment.target: Verify that the computers to which you want to deploy the package are included in your Configuration Manager inventory.

segment.source: Create a Configuration Manager computer collection that includes the computers.
segment.target: Create a Configuration Manager computer collection that includes the computers.

segment.source: Create a shared folder that contains the source image of the inventory-collector package.
segment.target: Create a shared folder that contains the source image of the inventory-collector package.

segment.source: Create a Configuration Manager package that is based on the source image from the shared folder.
segment.target: Create a Configuration Manager package that is based on the source image from the shared folder.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Create a Package.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Create a Package.

segment.source: Specify the Configuration Manager software distribution points.
segment.target: Specify the Configuration Manager software distribution points.

segment.source: Create a Configuration Manager program that includes the required commands and command-line options to deploy the inventory-collector package.
segment.target: Create a Configuration Manager program that includes the required commands and command-line options to deploy the inventory-collector package.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Create a Program.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Create a Program.

segment.source: Create a Configuration Manager advertisement that instructs Configuration Manager clients to run the program that you specified in the previous step.
segment.target: Create a Configuration Manager advertisement that instructs Configuration Manager clients to run the program that you specified in the previous step.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Create an Advertisement.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Create an Advertisement.

segment.source: To deploy an inventory-collector package from a network share
segment.target: To deploy an inventory-collector package from a network share

segment.source: Store your package (.msi) file in a shared folder on the network.
segment.target: Store your package (.msi) file in a shared folder on the network.

segment.source: Notify the users of the computers that require the inventory-collector package to run the .msi file.
segment.target: Notify the users of the computers that require the inventory-collector package to run the .msi file.

segment.source: For example, you might send an email message that includes a hyperlink to the shared folder.
segment.target: For example, you might send an email message that includes a hyperlink to the shared folder.

segment.source: To deploy an inventory-collector package to offline computers
segment.target: To deploy an inventory-collector package to offline computers

segment.source: In your inventory-collector package, specify a local output path for the log file.
segment.target: In your inventory-collector package, specify a local output path for the log file.

segment.source: Burn your.msi file to removable media.
segment.target: Burn your.msi file to removable media.

segment.source: Send the removable media to users of the offline computers.
segment.target: Send the removable media to users of the offline computers.

segment.source: Instruct the users to run the .msi file and then return the generated log file.
segment.target: Instruct the users to run the .msi file and then return the generated log file.

segment.source: For example, the users might send the log file in an email message or place the file on a network share.
segment.target: For example, the users might send the log file in an email message or place the file on a network share.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Identifying Computers for Inventory Collection
